document.masterDocTitle: The matchstick grasshopper genus Warramaba (Morabidae: Morabinae): a description of four new species and a photographic guide to the group

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The matchstick grasshopper genus Warramaba (Morabidae: Morabinae): a description of four new species and a photographic guide to the group

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type data (from White, Cheney and Key, 1963 ).
♀ fROm 9 mILES WNW. Of MONIA GAP , N.S.W., 17.II.1962 , KEY AND WHITE , REf. NO. (TO HAbITAT NOTES ) 5710. IN THE AUSTRALIAN NATIONAL INSECT COLLECTION , CANbERRA.

Description: SEE TAbLE 1 fOR mORPHOLOGICAL CHARACTERS Of THE
HOLOTYPE
, AND
FIGURE 4A–b
AND APPENDIX 1 fOR PHOTOGRAPHS Of LIvE SPECImENS.

Colouration: TYPICALLY bRIGHT TO DULL GREEN, wITH OCCASIONAL GREY mORPHS. PROmINENT bROwN TERGAL mARkINGS. LATERAL fACIAL STRIPES RED OR YELLOw, USUALLY wITH LATERAL YELLOw STRIPES ALONG PRONOTUm AND AbDOmEN; mAGENTA COLOURATION AbSENT; DISTINCT wHITE, AND OfTEN TRIANGULAR, mEDIAN fACIAL REGION.

Diagnosis: THE kARYOTYPE, wITH 2 n ♀ = 15, DERIvES fROm THE COmbINATION Of THE kARYOTYPES Of
W. whitei
sp. nov.
AND
W. flavolineata
sp. nov.
AND IS UNIqUE wITHIN THE GENUS wITH THE EXCEPTION Of
W. ngadju
sp. nov.
. IT CAN bE DISTINGUISHED fROm
W. ngadju
sp. nov.
AND OTHER mEmbERS Of THE GENUS bY COLOURATION, AS DESCRIbED IN THE kEY bELOw.

Distribution: THIS SPECIES IS THE ONLY mEmbER Of THE GENUS TO OCCUR OUTSIDE Of
WESTERN
AUSTRALIA
. IN THE EAST ( FIG. 1b ) IT IS fOUND IN A REGION APPROXImATELY bOUNDED bY THE TOwNS Of MILDURA , AND BROkEN HILL , CObAR AND HILLSTON , wITH A LATITUDINAL RANGE Of 31.27°S TO 34.59°S AND A LONGITUDINAL RANGE Of 141.36°E TO 146.04°E . IN
WESTERN
AUSTRALIA
( FIG. 1A & C ), IT IS fOUND IN A REGION EXTENDING SOUTH-wEST fROm KALGOORLIE wITH A LATITUDINAL RANGE Of 30.07°S TO 32.06°S AND A LONGITUDINAL RANGE Of 121.24°E TO 124.21°E .

Biology:
Warramaba virgo
IS AN ALL-fEmALE PARTHENOGENETIC SPECIES RESULTING fROm HYbRIDISATION EvENTS bETwEEN fEmALE
W. flavolineata
sp. nov.
AND mALE
W. whitei
sp. nov.
( HEwITT 1975 ; WHITE et al. 1977; KEARNEY AND BLACkET 2008 ). IT STRONGLY RESEmbLES
W. whitei
sp. nov.
mORPHOLOGICALLY, ESPECIALLY THE mORE NORTHERN POPULATIONS Of THE LATTER. THIS SPECIES mAY OCCUR SYmPATRICALLY wITH
W. ngadju
sp. nov.
AND AT SOmE SITES CAN bE fOUND ON THE SAmE fOOD PLANTS. IT HAS bEEN fOUND ON SHRUbS AND TREES Of THE GENERA
Acacia , Senna
AND
Dodonaea
.
